Subject: Accounting
Description: VCE Accounting explores and applies the financial recording, reporting, analysis and decision making systems and processes of a sole proprietor trading business. Students study the theoretical aspects of accounting and practically apply these principles. They collect, record, report, analyse, apply, evaluate and discuss accounting information using both manual and ICT based methods.

Subject: Accounting
Description: Students apply critical thinking skills to a range of business situations. They model alternative outcomes and use financial information generated to provide accounting advice to business owners, whilst taking into account ethical as well as financial considerations.

Subject: Accounting
Description: Accounting is the process of collecting, recording, reporting, analysing and interpreting financial and non-financial data and accounting information, and using it to model, forecast and provide advice to stakeholders in a business. This informs decision-making within the business, with a view to improving business performance. Accounting therefore plays an integral role in the successful and management of businesses.

Subject: Accounting
Description: VCE Accounting prepares students for a university or Technical and Further Education (TAFE) vocational study pathway to commerce, management and accounting, leading to careers in areas such as financial accounting; management accounting; forensic (investigative) accounting; taxation; environmental accounting; management; and corporate or personal financial planning.

Subject: Accounting
Description: This study enables students to:

Subject: Accounting
Description: Acquire knowledge and skills to record financial data and report accounting information in a manner that is appropriate for the needs of the user

Subject: Accounting
Description: Develop an understanding of the role of accounting in the management and operation of a business

Subject: Accounting
Description: Develop skills in the use of information and communications technology (ICT) in an accounting system

Subject: Accounting
Description: Develop the skills necessary to calculate the likely costs and returns when modelling a variety of options and make recommendations for a business

Subject: Accounting
Description: Develop an understanding of ethical considerations in relation to business decision-making

Subject: Accounting
Description: Develop the capacity to identify, analyse and interpret financial data and accounting information

Subject: Accounting
Description: Develop and apply critical thinking skills to a range of business situations

Subject: Accounting
Description: Use financial and other information to improve the accounting decision-making within a business.

Subject: Accounting
Description: The study is made up of 4 units:

Subject: Accounting
Description: Unit 1: The role of accounting in business (AC011, NHT: AC041)

Subject: Accounting
Description: Unit 2: Accounting and decision-making for a trading business (AC022, NHT: AC042)

Subject: Accounting
Description: Unit 3: Financial accounting for a trading business (AC033, NHT: AC043)

Subject: Accounting
Description: Unit 4: Recording, reporting, budgeting and decision-making (AC034, NHT: AC044)

Subject: Accounting
Description: Each unit deals with specific content contained in areas of study and is designed to enable students to achieve a set of outcomes for that unit. Each outcome is described in terms of key knowledge and key skills.

Subject: Accounting
Description: Units 1 and 2

Subject: Accounting
Description: Procedures for the assessment of levels of achievement in Units 1 and 2 are a matter for school decision. Assessment of levels of achievement for these units will not be reported to the VCAA. Schools may choose to report levels of achievement using grades, descriptive statements or other indicators.

Subject: Accounting
Description: Units 3 and 4

Subject: Accounting
Description: The VCAA specifies the assessment procedures for students undertaking scored assessment in Units 3 and 4. Designated assessment tasks are provided in the details for each unit in VCE study designs.

Subject: Accounting
Description: The student's level of achievement in Units 3 and 4 will be determined by School-assessed Coursework (SAC), as specified in the VCE study design, and external assessment.

Subject: Accounting
Description: The VCAA will report the student's level of achievement for each assessment component as a grade from A+ to E or UG (ungraded). To receive a study score, the student must achieve two or more graded assessments in the study and receive an S for both Units 3 and 4. The study score is reported on a scale of 0-50; it is a measure of how well the student performed in relation to all others who completed the study. Teachers should refer to the current VCE Administrative Handbook for details on graded assessment and calculation of the study score.

Subject: Accounting
Description: Percentage contributions to the study score in VCE Accounting are as follows:

Subject: Accounting
Description: Unit 3 School-assessed Coursework: 25 per cent

Subject: Accounting
Description: Unit 4 School-assessed Coursework: 25 per cent

Subject: Accounting
Description: End-of-year examination: 50 per cent.

Subject: Accounting
Description: Details of the assessment program are described in the sections on Units 3 and 4 in this study design.
